revised_title: Muscarinic Receptor Activation and Intracellular Calcium Modulation in Insect Neurons
tldr: This study investigates how muscarinic receptor activation in an insect motoneuron affects ligand-gated ion channels through changes in intracellular calcium levels. The results show that these receptors can modulate currents evoked by nicotinic acetylcholine receptors (nAChRs) and GABA receptors (GABARs) via calcium-dependent intracellular mechanisms. This finding indicates that muscarinic receptors can exert a powerful modulatory influence on neurons with these receptors co-localized.
